column4: hey guys... i got a new laptop yesterday.. installed ubuntu 7.10 on it... i installed compiz on it and gnome-compiz-preference.. in gnome-compiz preference... when i enable gl-desktop... none of the effects work... ie the cube rotation effect... what could be the reason for this?
you need to install the appropriate graphics drivers :)
so the one that came with ubuntu are the problem.. ok thanks ill search it up
you installed the restricted driver?
no i didnt!
try the restricted driver manager :) system -> manage -> restricted driver manager
it says your hardware doesnt not need any restricted drivers
which grahics card do you have in your laptop :)
i believe its an intel one....
now im not sure of the exact model.. i forgot what the cmd was to list hardware on the computer...
in a terminal, try "lspci"
that graphics chip seems ot be blacklisted
what do you mean?
in a terminal, do "compiz --replace &" and show us the output via http://paste.ubuntu.com/
so there are no drivers for that graphics card?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/5526/
ok, please check here how to avoid the blacklist http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=582112
ok thanks ill give it a read!
good luck :)
i took it off the blacklist... lets see if i get any problems in these few days!...
okido :)
thanks for your help!
happy to :)
